metadata.title: CVE-2020-6547 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Incorrect security UI in media in Google Chrome prior to 84.0.4147.125allowed a remote attacker to potentially obtain sensitive information via acrafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6547` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-browser-l10n - 85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-chromedriver - 85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '85.0.4183.83-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
